{"step_by_step_thinking": "Based on the information provided in the relevant documents, the mandibular third molars typically have two shorter, often parallel, mesial, and distal roots. However, there can be significant morphological variation in the mandibular third molar. In the case where the distal root is missing during extraction, it is most likely that the root tip is in the submandibular space.", "answer_choice": "B. Submandibular space"}
